Before you looms the Gate of Ash â€” a monolith scorched by centuries of flame and sorrow. Its surface crackles with veins of ember, pulsing like the last heartbeat of a dying god.

Three paths stretch from its base, each radiating a distinct dread.

To the left, a trail of molten rock winds into flame-choked valleys, where the air sings with heat and despair.

To the right, stairs spiral into a bottomless dark, untouched by sun or memory. And ahead lies a ruined causeway littered with idol fragments and the bones of kneeling pilgrims.

Each breath here feels heavier. Each step, a choice that echoes beyond time.
lore: It is said the Ash Gate was forged from the remains of the First Flame, quenched and hammered by divine will. It judges all who approach. Few return. None return unchanged.
